SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION ? EVENING - 3rd SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) British Front. Except on the 3rd Army front there is nothing new to report since the noon Battle Situation was issued.
On the 3rd Army front the enemy continues to give ground especially in the centre, and we are reported to be holding YTRES, ETRICOURT, and MANANCOURT.
North of the BAPAUME - CAMBRAI ROAD our patrols are reported to have reached the villages of INCHY-EN-ARTOIS and MOEUVRES.
(b)French, front. The situation is unchanged.
2. ITAlIAN FRONTS. There is nothing to report.
3. MACEDONIAN FRONT. Early on the morning of 2nd September the enemy attacked the positions captured by us west of the VARDAR on the 1st September. On the right he failed to reach our line, on the left he was driven back by a counter-attack.
We captured 66 prisoners during the fighting of the 1st and 2nd September.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.l.
3rd September, 1918.
Issued at 6-45 p.m.
